dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 602 IH: To amend the VA MISSION Act of 2018 to expand the Veterans Healing Veterans Medical Access and Scholarship Program to include more students and schools.
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mrs. González-Colón introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Veterans' Affairs

form.official-title: To amend the VA MISSION Act of 2018 to expand the Veterans Healing Veterans Medical Access and Scholarship Program to include more students and schools.

section.header: Veterans Healing Veterans Medical Access and Scholarship Program
section.text: Section 304 of the VA MISSION Act of 2018 (Public Law 115–182; 38 U.S.C. 7601 note) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (a), by striking 18 eligible veterans and inserting 28 eligible veterans; and

subparagraph.text: in the subsection heading, by striking Covered medical schools and inserting Definitions;
in paragraph (1), by redesignating subparagraphs (A) through (E) as clauses (i) through (v), respectively (and by moving such clauses two ems to the right);
by redesignating paragraphs (1) through (5) as subparagraphs (A) through (E), respectively (and by moving such subparagraphs two ems to the right);
by striking section, the term and inserting the following:
by adding at the end the following:
University of Puerto Rico School of Medicine.
Universidad Central del Caribe School of Medicine.
San Juan Bautista School of Medicine.
University of Texas Health Sciences Center at San Antonio.

paragraph.text: The term State has the meaning given that term in section 101 of title 38, United States Code.
